intro: Zeuxine reflexa, commonly known as the reflexed zeuxine, is a flowering plant species native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, which includes buttercups and other showy flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or wet meadows. Its flowers are small and usually pale yellow or greenish, with five sepals that reflex outward, giving it its common name. The plant has a short stem and produces numerous small, inconspicuous flowers that bloom in early spring.
